column1: '''Frodo of the Nine Fingers''' is a song written by [[Maury Laws]] (music) and [[Jules Bass]] (lyric) and performed by [[Glenn Yarbrough]] for the [[1980]] animated movie [[The Return of the King (1980 film)|''The Return of the King'']]. In the film
column2: it is sung by the [[Minstrel of Gondor]] (also played by Yarbrough) to help recount [[Frodo Baggins|Frodo]]'s journey to destroy [[the One Ring]].

column1: '''SPOKEN (MINSTREL OF GONDOR)''': "It has its beginnings two Ages past
When [[Bilbo Baggins|Bilbo]] set forth to reclaim the [[Dwarves]]' [[gold]]
And while on his quest Bilbo stumbled into a deep dank cave."
<poem style="font-style:italic; margin-left:20px;">When Bilbo found that shiny ring
He never thought that it would turn
They came to know the power of
He knew that it must be destroyed
In fires where it was wrought.
For if in evil hands it fell
The earth would know its end.
No force of arms would win the day
'''SPOKEN (GANDALF)''': "For evil flourished everywhere and lay on the land like a festering malignancy. There was one hope though
column4: heir to empty throne on [[Gondor]] awaited the small band to return and become king. But he could not triumph until the ring was destroyed

column1: <poem style="font-style:italic; margin-left:20px;">Frodo of the Nine Fingers
'''SPOKEN (GANDALF)''': "Frodo and his gallant companion [[Samwise Gamgee|Samwise]] had many brave adventures
column2: until finally they reached the rocky border of [[Mordor]]
column4: Frodo was captured and imprisoned in the [[Tower of Cirith Ungol]]. Samwise vowed to enter the Orc-infested tower alone to save him
column5: and the ring of doom was missing around Frodo's neck."

column1: <poem style="font-style:italic; margin-left:20px;">Frodo of the Nine Fingers
Why does he have nine fingers?
Where is the ring of doom?
